name: 8.13 "Sammy and the Professor" Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.correct: She just got a letter from the IRS.
options: She found out she was pregnant again.
Her oldest son was in prison.
questions.explanation:
She just got a letter from the IRS.

	Frasier told her, "there is nothing to fear but fear itself." She replied, "I'm being audited." Frasier answered, "And that."  Norm acted as Carla's accountant.

questions.text: How had Rebecca changed since college?
questions.explanation:
She got her braces off.

	She was so worried about what her former professor will think of her that she asks Sam to check her teeth. Sam tells her they look good and then offers to taste them as well. Leave it to Sam, always trying to find a way to come on to Rebecca.

questions.text: Who put gum under the table?
questions.explanation:
Carla.

	Rebecca was still in the process of trying to impress her professor, so she's cleaning the underside of the tables when she comes across a fresh piece of gum. Carla told her (as she tok the gum and puts it back in her mouth) "I've been looking for that piece it still has some good chews left in it."

Alice Anne Volkman.

	Alice Anne Volkman was played by Alexis Smith. Alexis Smith was born June 8, 1921 and died on June 9, 1993. Her birth name was Gladys Smith.

questions.text: What did Rebecca have a problem with?
questions.explanation:
Making decisions.

	Sam, Alice and Rebecca were at Melville's ordering dinner. The other two were eating their meal when Rebecca finally decided what she wanted to eat. The waiter handed her the dessert menu and said "I thought you'd want to hit the ground running."

questions.text: What did Rebecca give the professor?
questions.explanation:
Her term paper from 1977.

	Rebecca never finished her term paper in school so she kept on working on it. The term paper was called "Jimmy Carter: The Three Term President". Rebecca insisted "it could still happen". Apparently, Rebecca didn't know very much about the Amendments to the US Constitution as the 22nd Amendment states a president can only serve two full terms (unless they come in as vice president (ie president dies) then they can finish that presidents term plus their own two terms. Since Jimmy Carter was elected president, he could at most only serve as president one more time.

Woody.

	Woody told Rebecca that Robin was on the phone. She had told him to come up and pretend he called to impress Alice. However, he really was on the phone so she told Woody to take care of her meal.

questions.text: Who did Sam have sex with?
questions.explanation:
Alice.

	After dinner the two of them got together to discuss Sam buying the bar back. They ended up having a night cap, having sex and never talking about business.

questions.text: Who was upset that Sam had sex with the person he slept with?
questions.explanation:
Rebecca.

	Rebecca was repulsed when she found out. She couldn't believe a woman as classy as Alice would ever sleep with someone as unworthy as Sam Malone. It was even worse when Alice didn't know Sam's last name was Malone.

Carla.

	Carla did this on the advice of Norm. The IRS man said she had to come with him since it's illegal to make up false receipts. She told Norm she would get out for one reason "get Norm Peterson".
